titleStmt.title: Get In Line Report of City Federation of Colored Women's Clubs of Jacksonville, Florida
titleStmt.author: City Federation of Colored Women's Clubs of Jacksonville, Florida

publicationStmt.p: This document forms part of the project "Editing the Earth M.M. White Collection" at the University of North Florida.

msIdentifier.repository: University of North Florida, Thomas G. Carpenter Library Special Collections and Archives

msContents.summary: Report on the activities of the Jacksonville City Federation of Colored Women's Clubs.

objectDesc.p: A printed document of four pages made from a folded single page of paper.

editorialDecl.p: This file was transcribed and encoded according to the editorial criteria of the project "Editing the Eartha M.M. White Collection." Using the various options encoded within <choice> elements, this file enables the viewing of a diplomatic transcription and a regularized reading text.

head.name:
City Federation of Colored
Women's Clubs

div.p:
Motto: Not for ourselves, but for others.
Colors: White-Gold
Lightsy & Cain Print, 520 Broad St.Street

The first Colored Society in the United States to recieve
admission as a department of the American Red Cross.

Permanent arrangement for a Coloredcolored Playgroundplayground,
Miss Eartha White's name on Commitee.

The first to organize Canning Club among Colored in
city. Have over 46.

Participated in Patriotic Parade given by Safety Com
mittee.

Celebrated as usual: Good Health Week, Clean-Up
Week, Baby Week, co-operating with White Woman's Clubs.

Participated in celebrations: Emancipation Day, Lin
coln, Douglas and Washington Day, Memorial Day.

Held public platform meetings to get men to pay poll
taxes and vote.

President and white friends secured a Colored County
Canning Demonstrator.

The request in our last report relative to the Duval
county stockade was granted, and too much praise cannot
be given the County Commissioners for the wonderful im
provement. Everything is now up-to-date, in a perfectly
sanitary condition, with even a pool for bathing and a place for religious services.

Applied to City for a Socialsocial Workerworker. The same was
granted.

Asked for a School Medical Inspector. Two nurses were
given instead.

Have a loving cup for best-dilled company of boy
cadets.

June 14th, escorted Prospectedprospected officers of United States
Training Camp to depot.

June 17th Red Cross Night at Bethel Baptist Institu
tional Church.

Educating a young girl who is now in boarding school
and will finish next year.
A Detention Home.
A City Hospital.
A Club Building for our general headquarters.

Want Domestic Science Department of Stanton to excel
any in the United States.
Compulsory Education.
Total Prohibition.
